metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12351 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via adjacent access. Andy Nguyen discovered that the Bluetooth L2CAP implementation in the Linux kernel contained a type-confusion error. A physically proximate remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-122-generic - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-122-lowlatency - 4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-signed package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-122.124~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
